item.title: First-Time Home Buyer Guide for Florida: Documentation, Credit, and Loan Officer Selection
item.description:
Buying your first home in Florida is a significant financial decision. Understanding documentation requirements, credit expectations, down payment options, and how loan officers evaluate your application helps you approach the process with confidence and avoid surprises.

Understanding Down Payment Requirements for First-Time Buyers

Minimum Down Payments by Program:

Conventional Loans:

  • 3% down (with mortgage insurance)
  • 5% down (less mortgage insurance)
  • 10-20% down (minimal or no mortgage insurance)

item.title: I Ran a 14-Day Jumbo Loan Officer Selection Sprint
item.description: Most jumbo borrowers assume the right loan officer will magically appear when they email a private bank. I learned the hard way that the selection cycle matters as much as the rate sheet. My household carries income from a tech salary, venture distributions, and vesting stock, so documentation sprawl kills momentum. I decided to run a 14-day sprint to identify an officer who could keep up. Here is what I documented for every step so you can reuse the process.
